description: The expressions of the different rules follow the syntax of the SQL OLAP database... (truncated for brevity)

rules.name: screening_year_check
rules.description: Ensures the record belongs strictly to the 2025 screening campaign.

rules.name: round_sequence
rules.description: Validates that the screening round number is a positive integer.

rules.name: date_range_valid
rules.description: Ensures the screening round start date falls within the 2025 calendar year.

rules.name: date_chronology
rules.description: Ensures the round end date is after or equal to the start date.
rules.expression: screening_round_end >= screening_round_begin OR screening_round_end IS NULL

rules.name: attendance_logic
rules.description: Restricts previous attendance values to the allowed set (0, 1, 2, 99).

rules.name: first_round_consistency
rules.description: If it is the first round, previous attendance must be 2 (N/A).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN screening_round_number = 1 THEN screening_previous_attendance = 2 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: history_string_format
rules.description: Validates history string containing numeric values followed by true/false labels.
rules.expression: screening_history_string::VARCHAR IN ('true', 'false') OR screening_history_string IS NULL

rules.name: invitation_strict_logic
rules.description: Ensures invitation_date exists only for invited persons (1) and is NULL for others (0, 2, 99).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited = 1 THEN primary_invitation_date IS NOT NULL ELSE primary_invitation_date IS NULL END

rules.name: exclusion_consistency
rules.description: Enforces that protocol-excluded persons (2) must have an attendance status of 2.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited = 2 THEN primary_test_attended = 2 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: attendance_coherence
rules.description: Prevents 'Attended=Yes' (1) if the person was not invited (0) or was excluded (2).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited IN (0, 2) THEN primary_test_attended != 1 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: socioeconomic_values
rules.description: Validates categorical ranges for education (0-3, 99), income (0-4, 9, 99), and employment (0, 1, 99).
rules.expression: education IN (0, 1, 2, 3, 99) AND income IN (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 99) AND employment_status IN (0, 1, 99)

rules.name: risk_score_range
rules.description: Ensures the numerical preliminary risk score is within the 0 to 100 range.
rules.expression: preliminary_risk_score BETWEEN 0 AND 100 OR preliminary_risk_score IS NULL
